sentences.sContent: Crawford stressed the need for more housing downtown.
sentences.sCn: 克劳福德强调市中心需要建更多的住宅。

sentences.sContent: She stressed the importance of a balanced diet.
sentences.sCn: 她强调了均衡饮食的重要性。

sentences.sContent: ...To call stress an epidemic isn't exaggeration...
...In-office wellness programs may help reduce stress levels...
...The researchers found that “tele-pressure” is a major cause of stress at work...
...and employers are exploring ways to alleviate the harmful effects of stress and overwork...
...The conditions creating the stress are long hours...
...Health problems caused by stress in the workplace result in huge public health expenses...

...A study of employees at health insurance provider Aetna revealed that roughly one quarter of those taking in-office yoga and mindfulness classes reported a 28% reduction in their stress levels and a 20% improvement in sleep quality...
...nearly 50% say work-related stress is interfering with their sleep...
...Occupational stress increases the risk of heart attack and diabetes...
...The overwhelming majority of employees attribute their stress mainly to low pay and an excessive workload...
...showed a de-activation of the adversity stress response...
...People under stress may become anxious or depressed...
...people are more likely to pay attention to certain bodily sensations such as aches and pains when they are under stress and to think that they’re sick...
...What does the speaker say about people who encounter stress once in a while...
...What does the speaker say frequent stress reactions may lead to...
...And stress reactions can reduce the disease fighting effectiveness of the body’s immune system...
...But when stress is encountered continually...
...The continual speeding up of bodily reactions and production of stress related hormones seem to make people more susceptible to heart disease...

synos.tran: 压力；强调；紧张；重要性；重读
强调；使紧张；加压力于；用重音读

phrases.pCn: 温度应力，温差应力；热应力
n. 动态应力，动力应力

trans.tranOther: to emphasize a statement, fact, or idea
